help:
Type the following prompts for more information or guidance:

    General commands:
  • disclaimer: note about the website and its limitations
  • creator: learn more about the creator
  • repo: get the github repository link
  • features: see a full list of features
  • updates: see future updates and improvements coming soon
  • tech: stack used to build this website
  • example: see an example of a prompt and response
  • theme: switch theme mode
  • ai: print the ai model being utilized
  • copy: copy the last ai-generated code block in the chat
  • save: save the chat to workspace
  • clear: clear the chat from workspace
    • Switch chat type:
  • explain: switch to the code explanations chat
  • refactor: switch to the code refactoring chat
  • debug: switch to the code debugging chat
  • convert: switch to the code conversion chat

example:
User Prompt:

Explain how I can find the highest number in an array with JavaScript

AI-Generated Response:

To calculate the maximum number in an array in JavaScript, you can use the Math.max method along with the spread operator (...).
const numbers = [1, 5, 2, 10, 8];
const maxNumber = Math.max(...numbers);
In this example, we have an array of numbers [1, 5, 2, 10, 8]. By using Math.max and spreading the numbers array using the spread operator (...), we can find the maximum number in the array. The result will be stored in the maxNumber variable. In this case, maxNumber will be 10.
